Regarding the organic EL element according to the present example, light emission from three dopants of red, green, and blue was also observed in the manner akin to the manner in example 7, and it was found that the electron injection performance of the intermediate layer 20 was exerted and that both the first organic EL layer 10a and the second organic EL layer 10b emitted light.

When the light emission state of the resulting organic EL element was examined by using a microscope, light emission on the insulating layer was not observed, and there was no variations in light emission. Therefore, the resulting organic EL element was favorable.

According to the present disclosure, a layered type organic EL element is provided, the organic EL element including an intermediate layer exerting sufficient electron injection performance and having high resistance, by a vapor co-deposition layer of an easy-to-treat alkali metal compound and a metal of group II serving as the intermediate layer.

While the present disclosure has been described with reference to exemplary embodiments, it is to be understood that the invention is not limited to the disclosed exemplary embodiments. The scope of the following claims is to be accorded the broadest interpretation so as to encompass all such modifications and equivalent structures and functions.
This application claims the benefit of Japanese Patent Application No. 2021-095619, filed Jun. 8, 2021, which is hereby incorporated by reference herein in its entirety.

claim.claim-text: 1. An organic electroluminescence element comprising:a pair of electrodes; andat least two organic electroluminescence layers that are disposed between the pair of electrodes and that are stacked with an intermediate layer interposed therebetween,wherein the intermediate layer contains an alkali metal compound, a reduced form of the alkali metal compound, and a metal element of group II of the periodic table.
2. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the intermediate layer is a vapor co-deposition layer of the alkali metal compound and the metal element of group II.

3. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the intermediate layer is composed of only the alkali metal compound, the reduced form of the alkali metal compound, and the metal element of group II.

4. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the organic electroluminescence layer located closer to the intermediate layer than to a positive electrode includes an electron injection layer in contact with the intermediate layer, andthe electron injection layer contains the alkali metal compound and the reduced form of the alkali metal compound contained in the intermediate layer.
5. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 4,wherein the electron injection layer is an individual vapor deposition layer of the alkali metal compound.
6. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the metal element of group II contained in the intermediate layer is 75% by volume or less.
7. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the alkali metal compound is any one of lithium halides and lithium-quinolinol complexes.
8. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the alkali metal compound is lithium fluoride or potassium fluoride.
9. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the alkali metal compound is cesium carbonate.
10. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the metal element of group II is any one of magnesium, calcium, and strontium.
11. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the metal element of group II is magnesium.

12. The organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1,wherein the organic electroluminescence layer located closer to the intermediate layer than to a negative electrode includes a hole injection layer in contact with the intermediate layer.
13. An exposure light source of an electrophotographic image forming apparatus including the organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1.
14. A display apparatus comprising a plurality of pixels,wherein at least one of the plurality of pixels is the organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1.
15. The display apparatus according to claim 14, comprising a transistor connected to the organic electroluminescence element.

16. An imaging apparatus comprising:an optical portion including a plurality of lenses;an imaging element to receive light passed through the optical portion; anda display portion to display an image imaged by the imaging element,wherein the display portion includes the organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1.

17. Electronic equipment comprising a display portion including the organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1;a casing provided with the display portion; anda communications portion that is disposed in the casing and that communicates with an outside.

18. An illumination apparatus comprising:a light source including the organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1; andat least one of a light diffusion portion to pass through light emitted from the light source and an optical filter.
19. A mobile unit comprising:a lighting appliance including the organic electroluminescence element according to claim 1; anda bodywork provided with the lighting appliance.
